definition: the 10 heavenly stems 甲[jia3], 乙[yi3], 丙[bing3], 丁[ding1], 戊[wu4], 己[ji3], 庚[geng1], 辛[xin1], 壬[ren2], 癸[gui3], used cyclically in the calendar and as ordinal numbers I, II etc
day/sky/heaven
dry/clean/in vain/dried food/foster/adoptive/to ignore
variant of 乾|干[gan1]
old variant of 乾|干[gan1]
to concern/to interfere/shield/stem
surname Gan
tree trunk/main part of sth/to manage/to work/to do/capable/cadre/to kill (slang)/to fuck (vulgar)
the ten Heavenly Stems 甲[jia3], 乙[yi3], 丙[bing3], 丁[ding1], 戊[wu4], 己[ji3], 庚[geng1], 辛[xin1], 壬[ren2], 癸[gui3] (used cyclically in the calendar and as ordinal number like Roman I, II, III)

sentences.english: Think which day dry, is a lucky day that day.
sentences.chinese: 想哪天干，那天就是吉日。

sentences.english: Heavenly stems are a set of characters that were used to indicate order in ancient China.
sentences.chinese: 天干是中国古代的一种文字计序符号。

sentences.english: He never asked me what I’d gotten done on any particular day.
sentences.chinese: 他从不问我哪天干了什么事。

sentences.english: It is evolved and designed based on horologe and the ten Heavenly Stems timing in China.
sentences.chinese: 它是以中国日晷与天干计时为基础进行演化与设计的。

sentences.english: It was said that whenever there was a drought, the residents of Twin Dragon Town would come to this temple and pray for rain.
sentences.chinese: 相传每逢天干无雨，古双龙镇人便到此庙拜神求雨。

sentences.english: Parched fields mean they will have to buy in more feed than they'd like.
sentences.chinese: 天干地旱意味着，他们要比往年储备更多饲料。

sentences.english: Are they civil servants, who shouted to notice people that the weather is day and be careful in candle and fire?
sentences.chinese: 半夜在街上喊天干物燥小心火烛的更夫，算公务员吗？

definition: the 12 earthly branches 子[zi3], 丑[chou3], 寅[yin2], 卯[mao3], 辰[chen2], 巳[si4], 午[wu3], 未[wei4], 申[shen1], 酉[you3], 戌[xu1], 亥[hai4], used cyclically in the calendar and as ordinal numbers I, II etc
menstruation/woman's period
typical weather in a given season
the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1] and twelve earthly branches 十二枝/sexagenary cycle
the Yuezhi, an ancient people of central Asia during the Han dynasty (also written 月氏[Yue4 zhi1])
11th earthly branch: 7-9 p.m., 9th solar month (8th October-6th November), year of the Dog/ancient Chinese compass point: 300°
see 屈戌兒|屈戌儿[qu1 qu5 er5]
the character 8 or 八/birthdate characters used in fortune-telling
the ten Heavenly Stems 甲[jia3], 乙[yi3], 丙[bing3], 丁[ding1], 戊[wu4], 己[ji3], 庚[geng1], 辛[xin1], 壬[ren2], 癸[gui3] (used cyclically in the calendar and as ordinal number like Roman I, II, III)
51st year A3 of the 60 year cycle, e.g. 1974 or 2034
thirty-sixth year F12 of the 60 year cycle, e.g. 1959 or 2019
Mandate of Heaven/the Grand Canal, 1800 km from Beijing to Hangzhou, built starting from 486 BC/usually written 大運河|大运河[Da4 Yun4 he2]
forty-ninth year I1 of the 60 year cycle, e.g. 1972 or 2032
fifty-second year B4 of the 60 year cycle, e.g. 1975 or 2035
sixtieth year J12 of the 60 year cycle, e.g. 1983 or 2043
fifty-fourth year D6 of the 60 year cycle, e.g. 1977 or 2037
same as 天干/the 10 heavenly stems 甲, 乙, 丙, 丁, 戊, 己, 庚, 辛, 壬, 癸 (used cyclically in the calendar and as ordinal number like Roman I, II, III)
